column2: How likely are you to recommend our events to a friend or colleague?
column4: Please rate the following aspects of the event [Venue]
column5: Please rate the following aspects of the event [Speakers]
column6: Please rate the following aspects of the event [Content Relevance]
column7: What did you like most about the event?
column8: What could be improved?
column9: Any additional comments?

column3: Keynote: The Future of AI in Research, Paper Session A: NLP Advances
column7: The keynote was thought-provoking. As a virtual attendee, the streaming quality was flawless.
column8: The online platform for Q&A was a bit clunky. A simple chat window might have been better.
column9: Excellent content. The hybrid model was executed very well.

column7: The methodology clinic was quite useful.
column8: It was very difficult for remote attendees to see the posters or interact with presenters during the poster session. This part felt very in-person focused.
column9: The gap between the in-person and online experience was significant during the poster session.

column3: Paper Session A: NLP Advances, Networking Lunch
column7: The quality of the papers presented was very high. The in-person networking was also valuable.
column8: The room for Paper Session A was too small and felt crowded. Many people had to stand.
column9: Great to be back in person. The energy is different.

column3: Keynote: The Future of AI in Research
column7: I appreciate the option to attend remotely.
column8: The audio from the in-person audience's microphones was terrible. I couldn't hear any of the questions being asked in the room.
column9: The experience for remote attendees needs to be a priority

column7: The feedback I received in the Doctoral Consortium was invaluable. The senior researchers were very generous with their time.
column9: As a PhD student, this was exactly what I needed. Thank you.

column7: The research presented was cutting-edge.
column8: The online platform kept crashing on my Firefox browser. I had to switch to Chrome halfway through.
column9: Please ensure cross-browser compatibility for the virtual platform.

column7: The catering for the lunch was good.
column8: The poster session was chaotic. There was no clear flow or numbering system to find specific posters.
column9: A little more organization for the poster session would go a long way.

column3: Keynote: The Future of AI in Research, Doctoral Consortium
column7: The ability to switch between the in-person event and watching a session from my hotel room was fantastic.
column9: Hybrid is the future! This was a great example of how to do it right.

column7: The speaker was an expert in the field and the advice was very practical.
column8: It felt like the speaker was only addressing the in-person audience. They rarely looked at the camera for the virtual attendees.
column9: A small amount of speaker training on engaging a hybrid audience could be beneficial.

column8: The presentation slides were often unreadable on the stream due to low resolution. The speaker's code snippets were just a blur.
column9: The streaming bitrate needs to be higher for technical content.

column7: Great opportunity to connect with colleagues I haven't seen in years.
column9: The value of in-person connection cannot be overstated.

column3: Keynote: The Future of AI in Research
column7: The online platform was easy to navigate.
column8: The keynote topic was too broad and didn't offer much depth for specialists in the field.
column9: An okay start to the workshop
column10: but I was hoping for more technical substance.

column7: The work on generative models was groundbreaking. The Q&A with the author was very insightful.
column9: This session alone made the workshop worth attending.

column7: I liked the poll feature for online attendees to vote on questions.
column8: The in-person attendees' questions always seemed to get priority over the online ones.

column7: I was excited about the topic.
column8: The speaker had technical issues and the session started 30 minutes late. The content was then rushed to finish on time.
column9: Very disappointing. Punctuality is important, especially in a packed schedule.

column7: The mentors were excellent.
column8: The breakout rooms for the virtual attendees in the consortium were not set up correctly at first
column9: which caused some confusion.

column8: As a virtual attendee, I felt completely excluded from the poster session. There was no virtual equivalent.
column9: If a session is a core part of the workshop
column10: there must be a hybrid-friendly way to participate.

column7: The quality of the research and the clarity of the presentation were outstanding.
column9: A model presentation. I will be using this as an example for my own students.

column7: The online 'networking' breakout rooms were a good attempt.
column8: The random breakout rooms are not as effective as organic conversation. It felt a bit forced.

column3: Keynote: The Future of AI in Research
column8: It was hard to feel the 'energy' of the room as a remote attendee. Maybe a camera facing the audience would help?

column7: The speaker provided their code and datasets
column8: which is fantastic for reproducibility.
column10: This is how academic workshops should beâ€”open and collaborative.

column7: The content was highly relevant to my dissertation work.
column8: The final 10 minutes were very rushed
column9: and there was no time for questions.
column10: Even one or two questions would have been very valuable.

column7: I attended in person.
column8: The options for dietary restrictions were very limited
column9: despite me indicating my needs on the registration form.
column10: This is an inclusivity issue that is easy to get right.

column7: The online format worked surprisingly well for the small group discussions.
column9: I was skeptical about a virtual consortium

column7: The topic was interesting.
column8: The speaker assumed a lot of prior knowledge
column9: making it difficult for newcomers to the sub-field to follow.
column10: A brief introduction with key definitions would have been helpful.

column3: Keynote: The Future of AI in Research
column7: A very inspiring and forward-looking talk.
column9: It provided a great high-level context for the more specific sessions that followed.

column7: The physical layout was spacious and well-organized.
column8: The time allocated was too short to see all the posters I was interested in.
The speaker's audio was very poor. It kept cutting in and out, making the talk impossible to follow.
column9: A basic microphone check before the session starts is essential for hybrid events.

column7: The seamless integration between in-person and virtual was the best I've ever seen.
column8: I honestly can't think of anything. It was a masterclass in hybrid events.
column9: Whatever your tech setup is
column10: please write a blog post about it!
